background.description: A color that typically appears behind scrollable content.

onBackground.description: A color that's clearly legible when drawn on background.

error.description: The color to use for input validation errors, e.g. for InputDecoration.errorText.

errorContainer.description: A color used for error elements needing less emphasis than error.

inversePrimary.description: An accent color used for displaying a highlight color on inverseSurface backgrounds, like button text in a SnackBar.

inverseSurface.description: A surface color used for displaying the reverse of what's seen in the surrounding UI, for example in a SnackBar to bring attention to an alert.

onError.description: A color that's clearly legible when drawn on error.

onErrorContainer.description: A color that's clearly legible when drawn on errorContainer.

onInverseSurface.description: A color that's clearly legible when drawn on inverseSurface.

onPrimary.description: A color that's clearly legible when drawn on primary.

onPrimaryContainer.description: A color that's clearly legible when drawn on primaryContainer.

onSecondary.description: A color that's clearly legible when drawn on secondary.

onSecondaryContainer.description: A color that's clearly legible when drawn on secondaryContainer.

onSurface.description: A color that's clearly legible when drawn on surface.

onSurfaceVariant.description: A color that's clearly legible when drawn on surfaceVariant.

onTertiary.description: A color that's clearly legible when drawn on tertiary.

onTertiaryContainer.description: A color that's clearly legible when drawn on tertiaryContainer.

outline.description: A utility color that creates boundaries and emphasis to improve usability.

outlineVariant.description: A utility color that creates boundaries for decorative elements when a 3:1 contrast isn’t required, such as for dividers or decorative elements.

primary.description: The color displayed most frequently across your app’s screens and components.

primaryContainer.description: A color used for elements needing less emphasis than primary.

scrim.description: A color use to paint the scrim around of modal components.

secondary.description: An accent color used for less prominent components in the UI, such as filter chips, while expanding the opportunity for color expression.

secondaryContainer.description: A color used for elements needing less emphasis than secondary.

shadow.description: A color use to paint the drop shadows of elevated components.

surface.description: The background color for widgets like Card.

surfaceTint.description: A color used as an overlay on a surface color to indicate a component's elevation.

surfaceVariant.description: A color variant of surface that can be used for differentiation against a component using surface.

tertiary.description: A color used as a contrasting accent that can balance primary and secondary colors or bring heightened attention to an element, such as an input field.

tertiaryContainer.description: A color used for elements needing less emphasis than tertiary.

displayMedium.description: Middle size of the display styles.

headlineMedium.description: Middle size of the headline styles.

titleMedium.description: Middle size of the title styles.

labelMedium.description: Middle size of the label styles.

bodyMedium.description: Middle size of the body styles.

shadowColor.description: The color to paint the shadow below the card.

surfaceTintColor.description: The color used as an overlay on color to indicate elevation.

elevation.description: The z-coordinate at which to place this card. This controls the size of the shadow below the card.

margin.description: The empty space that surrounds the card.

animationDuration.description: Defines the duration of animated changes for shape and elevation in ms.

hovered.description: The background color when the user drags their mouse cursor over the given widget.

focused.description: The background color when the user navigates with the keyboard to a given widget.

pressed.description: The background color when the user is actively pressing down on the given widget.

dragged.description: The background color when this widget is being dragged from one place to another by the user.

selected.description: The background color when this item has been selected.

scrolledUnder.description: The background color when this widget overlaps the content of a scrollable below.

disabled.description: The background color when this widget is disabled and cannot be interacted with.

error.description: The background color when the widget has entered some form of invalid state.

hovered.description: The foreground color when the user drags their mouse cursor over the given widget.

focused.description: The foreground color when the user navigates with the keyboard to a given widget.

pressed.description: The foreground color when the user is actively pressing down on the given widget.

dragged.description: The foreground color when this widget is being dragged from one place to another by the user.

selected.description: The foreground color when this item has been selected.

scrolledUnder.description: The foreground color when this widget overlaps the content of a scrollable below.

disabled.description: The foreground color when this widget is disabled and cannot be interacted with.

error.description: The foreground color when the widget has entered some form of invalid state.

error.description: The icon color when the widget has entered some form of invalid state.

dragged.description: The overlay color when this widget is being dragged from one place to another by the user.

focused.description: The shadow color when the user navigates with the keyboard to a given widget.

pressed.description: The shadow color when the user is actively pressing down on the given widget.

dragged.description: The shadow color when this widget is being dragged from one place to another by the user.

selected.description: The shadow color when this item has been selected.

scrolledUnder.description: The shadow color when this widget overlaps the content of a scrollable below.

disabled.description: The shadow color when this widget is disabled and cannot be interacted with.

error.description: The shadow color when the widget has entered some form of invalid state.
